ground_truth: Elsa is walking away in an open area, with torches, vehicles, and Nazi Officers in the background, one of whom is Indy, who comes up to her before she knows he is there. Indy pushes Elsa against a column and begins to search her clothing for the Diary, pulling the book from her pocket. His hands fly to her neck, but Indy releases her and backs away, and she looks at him with a lover's pain. Indy moves over to Henry, and they almost run headlong into Hitler and his entire entourage coming down from the podium. Fifty kids push their autograph books for Hitler's signature, and Hitler pauses to sign them, then looks Indy's way, and they make eye contact. Hitler breaks the spell by taking the Grail Diary from Indy, opens it to the first page, and signs his autograph, then hands it back and moves on. Indy’s motorcycle pulls up to the main terminal as a Plainclothes Agent distributes leaflets bearing Henry's picture to Nazi Soldiers inside the terminal. Henry leans in a doorway reading a newspaper as Indy enters down the stairs and taps Henry's shoulder. They begin to walk toward the boarding gates, with Henry looking over his newspaper at Indy, but Indy looks out the window and is suddenly concerned, rushing across the tarmac toward the Zeppelin. Henry looks confused as everyone else with a ticket quickly produces it and waves it in Indy’s face. Vogel gets to his knees as the huge Zeppelin rises into the sky above him, revealing an airplane attached to the belly of the airship, and he shakes his fist at the rising Zeppelin. Henry opens his Diary and begins to thumb through it, looking up from it, then closes it and leans back in his seat. Indy stutters uncomfortably as Henry stares at him, waiting for a response, while sunlight falls across the table from the window, turning like the hand of a clock over the tabletop across the drinks. Indy appears puzzled as he and his father emerge from the hatchway into the belly of the Zeppelin, where the Zeppelin's elaborate metal framework is exposed. Indy and Henry hurry down the catwalk until arriving at a pair of doorways framed into the Zeppelin's outer skin, with plenty of blue sky and white clouds visible, and a small Biplane suspended from the Zeppelin by a hook and crane device. Indy climbs into the cockpit of the Biplane as Henry takes the tail gunner's seat, then they both become aware of a strange sound in the skies behind them. Two Messerschmidt fighter bombers streak out of the clouds and race across the sky, forcing them to shrink in their seats as the Messerschmidts, going three times as fast, scream past on either side.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Elsa is strolling away in an open expanse, with torches, vehicles, and Nazi Officers in the backdrop, one of whom is Indy, who approaches her before she realizes he is there. Indy shoves Elsa against a pillar and begins to search her attire for the Journal, pulling the volume from her pocket. His hands fly to her neck, but Indy releases her and retreats, and she gazes at him with a lover's pain. Indy advances over to Henry, and they almost run headlong into Hitler and his entire retinue descending from the platform. Fifty children push their autograph volumes for Hitler's signature, and Hitler pauses to sign them, then looks Indy's way, and they make eye contact. Hitler breaks the enchantment by taking the Grail Journal from Indy, opens it to the first page, and signs his autograph, then hands it back and moves on. Indy’s motorcycle pulls up to the main depot as a Plainclothes Operative distributes pamphlets bearing Henry's picture to Nazi Soldiers inside the terminal. Henry leans in a doorway perusing a newspaper as Indy enters down the stairs and taps Henry's shoulder. They commence to walk toward the boarding gates, with Henry peering over his newspaper at Indy, but Indy looks out the window and is suddenly concerned, rushing across the tarmac toward the Zeppelin. Henry looks bewildered as everyone else with a ticket quickly produces it and waves it in Indy’s face. Vogel gets to his knees as the gigantic Zeppelin ascends into the sky above him, revealing an aircraft attached to the underside of the airship, and he shakes his fist at the ascending Zeppelin. Henry opens his Journal and begins to thumb through it, looking up from it, then closes it and reclines back in his seat. Indy stammers uncomfortably as Henry gazes at him, awaiting a response, while sunlight falls across the table from the window, rotating like the hand of a clock over the tabletop across the beverages. Indy appears puzzled as he and his father emerge from the hatchway into the belly of the Zeppelin, where the Zeppelin's intricate metal framework is exposed. Indy and Henry hurry down the catwalk until arriving at a pair of doorways framed into the Zeppelin's outer skin, with plenty of azure sky and white clouds visible, and a small Biplane suspended from the Zeppelin by a hook and crane apparatus. Indy climbs into the cockpit of the Biplane as Henry takes the tail gunner's seat, then they both become aware of a peculiar noise in the skies behind them. Two Messerschmidt fighter bombers streak out of the clouds and race across the sky, forcing them to shrink in their seats as the Messerschmidts, going three times as fast, scream past on either side.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Elsa is being walked away from in an open area, with torches, vehicles, and Nazi Officers in the background, including Indy, who approaches her before he is noticed by her. Elsa is pushed against a column by Indy, and her clothing is searched by him for the Diary, with the book being pulled from her pocket. His hands fly to her neck, but she is released by Indy, who backs away, and he is looked at by her with a lover's pain. Henry is moved over to by Indy, and they almost run headlong into Hitler and his entire entourage, who are coming down from the podium. Fifty kids push their autograph books for Hitler's signature, and they are signed by Hitler, who then looks Indy's way, and eye contact is made between them. The spell is broken by Hitler by taking the Grail Diary from Indy, opening it to the first page, and signing his autograph, then handing it back and moving on. Indy’s motorcycle is pulled up to the main terminal by him as a Plainclothes Agent distributes leaflets bearing Henry's picture to Nazi Soldiers inside the terminal. Henry leans in a doorway reading a newspaper as Indy enters down the stairs and taps Henry's shoulder. Toward the boarding gates, they begin to walk, with Henry looking over his newspaper at Indy, but the window is looked out of by Indy, who becomes suddenly concerned, rushing across the tarmac toward the Zeppelin. The confused look is given by Henry as everyone else with a ticket quickly produces it and waves it in Indy’s face. His knees are gotten to by Vogel as the huge Zeppelin rises into the sky above him, revealing an airplane attached to the belly of the airship, and the rising Zeppelin is shaken a fist at by him. His Diary is opened by Henry, and he begins to thumb through it, looking up from it, then closes it and leans back in his seat. Indy stutters uncomfortably as he is stared at by Henry, waiting for a response, while sunlight falls across the table from the window, turning like the hand of a clock over the tabletop across the drinks. Indy appears puzzled as the hatchway is emerged from by him and his father into the belly of the Zeppelin, where the Zeppelin's elaborate metal framework is exposed. Until arriving at a pair of doorways framed into the Zeppelin's outer skin, with plenty of blue sky and white clouds visible, and a small Biplane suspended from the Zeppelin by a hook and crane device, Indy and Henry hurry down the catwalk. Indy climbs into the cockpit of the Biplane as Henry takes the tail gunner's seat, then a strange sound in the skies behind them is noticed by both. Two Messerschmidt fighter bombers streak out of the clouds and race across the sky, forcing Indy and Henry to shrink in their seats as they are screamed past on either side by the Messerschmidts, going three times as fast.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Elsa walks in an open area with torches, vehicles, and Nazi Officers behind her, including Indy, who approaches unnoticed. Indy pushes Elsa against a column, searches her clothing, and finds the Diary in her pocket. His hands move to her neck, but he releases her and steps back. They exchange a pained look before Indy joins Henry. They nearly collide with Hitler, surrounded by children seeking autographs. Hitler signs and returns the Grail Diary to Indy. Indy’s motorcycle arrives at the terminal, where a Plainclothes Agent hands out leaflets with Henry's picture to Nazi Soldiers. Henry reads a newspaper as Indy taps his shoulder, and they head to the boarding gates. Indy suddenly rushes toward the Zeppelin, leaving Henry confused. Vogel watches as the Zeppelin, with a Biplane attached, rises. Henry thumbs through his Diary, then closes it, leaning back. Indy stutters under Henry's gaze as sunlight moves like a clock hand over the table. Indy and Henry, puzzled, exit to the Zeppelin's belly, revealing its metal framework. They hurry to doorways in the outer skin, climb into a Biplane, and hear an alarming sound. Two Messerschmidt fighters race overhead, forcing them to duck as they zoom past.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Elsa walks away in an open area, with torches, vehicles, and Nazi Officers, including Indy, who approaches her. Indy pushes Elsa against a column, searches her for the Diary, and pulls it from her pocket. His hands move to her neck but then releases her. Indy looks at Elsa, who returns his gaze with pain, then turns to Henry. They nearly collide with Hitler and his entourage, and amidst autograph seekers, Hitler signs the Grail Diary and returns it to Indy. Indy’s motorcycle arrives at the terminal as a Plainclothes Agent distributes Henry's wanted leaflets. As Indy taps Henry’s shoulder, they head to the gates. Indy suddenly rushes to the Zeppelin, leaving Henry puzzled. As ticket holders wave their tickets, Vogel kneels angrily as the Zeppelin, with a plane attached beneath, ascends. Henry examines his Diary, then relaxes, while Indy stutters under Henry's gaze. They enter the Zeppelin's framework and hurry to doorways revealing sky and clouds and a Biplane suspended beneath. Indy climbs into the Biplane cockpit as Henry takes the tail gunner's seat, as two Messerschmidt fighters suddenly streak past, forcing them to duck.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Elsa is seen making her way out, walking purposefully in an expansive open area where torches cast flickering shadows, and vehicles are stationed. In the background, there are Nazi Officers, one of whom happens to be Indy. He discreetly approaches her from behind before she realizes his presence. Swiftly and decisively, Indy pushes Elsa up against a sturdy column and starts to meticulously search through her clothing, looking for the Diary. He deftly extracts the book from her pocket. In a moment of tension, his hands dart to her neck, but he then decides to release her and steps back. Elsa gazes at him with a look filled with a lover's pain and betrayal. Indy then shifts his focus to Henry, and as the two nearly collide with Hitler and his entire entourage descending from the podium, they must act swiftly. A crowd of fifty enthusiastic kids eagerly thrust their autograph books forward, clamoring for Hitler to sign them. Hitler obliges, pausing to briefly scribble his name, and then, unexpectedly, he turns his gaze toward Indy, locking eyes with him. In that tense moment, Hitler dispels any unease by taking the Grail Diary from Indy, casually flipping it open to the first page, signing his autograph with nonchalance before handing it back to Indy and continuing on his way.

As events unfold, Indy's motorcycle rolls up to the main terminal, where a Plainclothes Agent is busily distributing leaflets featuring Henry's picture to the Nazi Soldiers stationed inside the terminal. Henry stands casually leaning in a doorway, engrossed in reading a newspaper, as Indy makes his entrance, descending the stairs and giving Henry a light tap on the shoulder. Together, they start to stride purposefully toward the boarding gates. Henry glances over the top of his newspaper at Indy, who meanwhile gazes out the window, suddenly overcome by concern as he hurriedly dashes across the tarmac toward the Zeppelin. Henry, looking perplexed, watches as ticketed passengers quickly retrieve and brandish their tickets in Indy’s face, signaling urgency. Vogel, overcome with frustration, falls to his knees as the massive Zeppelin ascends majestically into the sky, revealing an airplane cleverly fastened to its underside. He shakes his fist vehemently at the rising Zeppelin, a picture of thwarted anger.

In the air, Henry opens his Diary, thoughtfully flipping through the pages, before gazing upward from it, eventually shutting the book and reclining back in his seat with a contemplative air. Indy, meanwhile, appears visibly uneasy, stammering awkwardly as Henry maintains an expectant gaze upon him, waiting patiently for some form of response. The sunlight streaming in through the window casts its glow across the table, rotating like the hand of a clock over the surface and illuminating the drinks in its path. Indy finds himself perplexed as he and his father emerge hesitantly from the hatchway, entering the belly of the Zeppelin where its intricate metal framework is on full display. They hastily proceed along the catwalk until they reach a pair of doorways cleverly framed into the Zeppelin's outer skin. Looking out, they see the vast expanse of blue sky and billowing white clouds, alongside a small Biplane suspended securely from the Zeppelin by a hook and crane apparatus. Indy climbs into the cockpit of the Biplane, while Henry assumes his position in the tail gunner's seat. It is at this moment that they both become keenly aware of an unusual sound resonating in the skies behind them. Suddenly, two sleek Messerschmidt fighter bombers burst from the clouds, slicing through the sky. The rapid approach of these aircraft forces Indy and Henry to shrink back in their seats as the Messerschmidts, traveling at three times their speed, scream past them on either side with a deafening roar.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Elsa is observed making her way out, walking with deliberate purpose across an expansive, open area. In this large space, torches cast flickering, dancing shadows, and vehicles stand stationed in readiness. In the backdrop of this scene, several Nazi Officers are present, one of whom, somewhat surprisingly, is Indiana Jones, known as Indy. He discreetly and quietly makes his approach towards Elsa from behind, ensuring she does not realize his presence until the last moment. With swiftness and decisiveness, Indy pushes Elsa up against a solid, sturdy column and begins to meticulously search through her clothing, specifically looking for the all-important Diary. He deftly and skillfully manages to extract the book from one of her pockets. In a tense moment, his hands move swiftly to her neck, but he ultimately chooses to release her and carefully steps back. Elsa gazes at him with eyes filled with the emotional pain and betrayal of a lover scorned. Following this, Indy shifts his sharp focus to Henry, and as they move, they nearly collide with Hitler and his entire entourage, who are descending from the podium. They must react quickly. Fifty enthusiastic children, filled with excitement, eagerly thrust their autograph books forward, clamoring for Hitler to sign them. Obliging them, Hitler pauses in his stride to casually scribble his name, and then, unexpectedly, he locks eyes with Indy. In that tense, electrifying moment, Hitler dispels any unease by nonchalantly taking the Grail Diary from Indy, casually flipping it open to inspect the first page, and without much thought, signing his autograph before handing it back to Indy and continuing on his way.

As the sequence of events continues to unfold, Indy’s motorcycle pulls up to the main terminal. There, a Plainclothes Agent is diligently distributing leaflets that prominently feature Henry’s picture to the Nazi Soldiers stationed inside this busy hub. Henry stands nonchalantly, casually leaning in a doorway, engrossed in reading a newspaper as Indy makes his entrance. He descends the stairs and gives Henry a light, friendly tap on the shoulder. Together, they begin to stride purposefully toward the bustling boarding gates. Henry glances over the top edge of his newspaper at Indy, who, at the same time, gazes intently out the window. Suddenly, he is overcome by a sense of urgency and concern as he hurriedly dashes across the tarmac toward the enormous Zeppelin. Henry, looking perplexed, watches this unfold as ticketed passengers quickly retrieve and brandish their tickets in Indy’s face, signaling the pressing urgency of the situation. Overcome with frustration, Vogel falls to his knees on the tarmac as the massive Zeppelin ascends majestically and gracefully into the sky, revealing an airplane cleverly fastened to its underside. He shakes his fist vehemently in the air at the rising Zeppelin, embodying a picture of thwarted anger and helpless rage.

Up in the air, Henry opens his well-worn Diary, thoughtfully flipping through its crucial pages, before gazing upward from it. Eventually, after a moment of contemplation, he shuts the book and reclines back in his seat with a reflective air. Meanwhile, Indy appears visibly uneasy, his words faltering as he stammers awkwardly under Henry’s expectant gaze. Henry sits patiently, waiting for some form of response from Indy. The sunlight from outside streams in through the window, casting its warm glow across the table. It rotates like the hand of a clock over the table’s surface, illuminating the drinks in its path. Indy feels perplexed as he and his father cautiously emerge through the hatchway, entering the belly of the colossal Zeppelin where its intricate metal framework is displayed in full. They hastily proceed along the narrow catwalk until they reach a pair of doorways cleverly framed into the Zeppelin's outer structure. Looking out, they are greeted by the vast expanse of blue sky and the sight of billowing white clouds, alongside a small Biplane suspended securely from the Zeppelin by a hook and crane apparatus. Indy climbs into the cockpit of the Biplane, while Henry takes his position in the tail gunner's seat. It is at this precise moment that they both become acutely aware of an unusual sound resonating in the skies behind them. Suddenly, two sleek, menacing Messerschmidt fighter bombers burst from the clouds, slicing through the sky with razor-sharp precision. The rapid and aggressive approach of these aircraft forces Indy and Henry to shrink back instinctively in their seats as the Messerschmidts, traveling at three times their speed, scream past them on either side with a thunderous, deafening roar.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Elsa strides purposefully away across an open expanse, her path distinctly marked by the presence of torches, vehicles, and uniformed Nazi officers in the backdrop. Among them, stealthily approaching, is Indy, who manages to reach her unnoticed. With swift determination, Indy abruptly pushes Elsa against a sturdy column, his actions focused and precise as he meticulously searches her clothing. His fingers deftly maneuver through fabric until they uncover the hidden Diary, which he extracts from her pocket with a sense of urgency. In a moment of tension, his hands instinctively move toward her neck, but then he pauses and chooses to release her, stepping back to create space between them. She gazes at him with an expression filled with the anguish of a lover's wound. Indy redirects his attention and advances toward Henry, their path almost colliding head-on with Hitler and his imposing entourage descending from a nearby podium. Amidst this unexpected encounter, a throng of fifty children eagerly thrust their autograph books towards Hitler, who, pausing graciously, takes the time to sign them. His gaze momentarily shifts, catching sight of Indy, and they lock eyes in a moment of silent recognition. The tense moment is broken as Hitler unexpectedly takes the Grail Diary from Indy, flips it open to the first page, and nonchalantly adds his signature before returning it and continuing on his way. Meanwhile, Indy's motorcycle arrives at the main terminal, where a Plainclothes Agent is busy distributing leaflets bearing Henry's image to the Nazi Soldiers stationed inside. In another part of the terminal, Henry, engrossed in a newspaper, leans casually in a doorway when Indy descends the stairs, tapping his shoulder to capture his attention. Together, they begin their walk toward the boarding gates; Henry intermittently peers over his newspaper at Indy, who suddenly shifts his gaze out the window, spotting something that heightens his concern. With urgency, Indy dashes across the tarmac, his sights locked on a Zeppelin looming majestically above. Henry, meanwhile, is left bewildered as they encounter a surge of people brandishing tickets, which they promptly wave in Indy's direction. As the massive Zeppelin ascends skyward, Vogel drops to his knees in a futile gesture, vehemently shaking his fist toward the rising airship. In the cabin, Henry opens his Diary, flipping thoughtfully through its pages before closing it and settling back into his seat. Across the table, sunlight dances, casting shifting shadows like a clock's hands over their drinks, while Indy falters awkwardly, met by Henry's expectant stare. The tension lingers as Indy appears puzzled, their journey taking them to the hatchway, emerging into the expansive belly of the Zeppelin where a complex lattice of metal framework envelops them. Hurrying along the catwalk, they reach a set of doorways embedded into the Zeppelin's outer surface, beyond which lies a vast expanse of blue sky and scattered white clouds. Suspended from the Zeppelin's underbelly is a small Biplane, held by a hook and crane apparatus. Indy climbs deftly into the Biplane's cockpit as Henry assumes position in the tail gunner's seat, both becoming acutely aware of an ominous sound approaching from behind. Their senses heighten as two Messerschmidt fighter bombers burst forth from the clouds, slicing through the sky with incredible speed, compelling Indy and Henry to brace themselves, shrinking into their seats as the Messerschmidts, at thrice their velocity, roar past them on either side.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Elsa walks away in an open area with torches, vehicles, and Nazi Officers in the background, including Indy, who approaches unnoticed. He pushes Elsa against a column, searches her clothing for the Diary, and finds it in her pocket. After a tense moment where his hands fly to her neck, Indy releases her and retreats, leaving Elsa with a look of pained affection. Indy joins Henry, and they nearly collide with Hitler and his entourage descending the podium. Hitler, approached by children seeking autographs, notices Indy, takes the Grail Diary from him, signs it, and returns it before moving on.

Indy’s motorcycle arrives at the terminal as a Plainclothes Agent distributes leaflets with Henry's picture to Nazi Soldiers. Henry reads a newspaper in a doorway as Indy taps his shoulder, prompting them to head toward the boarding gates. Indy, suddenly concerned, rushes across the tarmac toward the Zeppelin as Henry looks on, confused, while ticket holders wave their tickets at Indy. Vogel kneels frustrated as the Zeppelin ascends, revealing an airplane underneath, shaking his fist at it.

Inside the Zeppelin, Henry flips through his Diary and then relaxes in his seat. Indy, appearing puzzled, interacts awkwardly with Henry under the shifting sunlight. They soon emerge from the hatchway into the Zeppelin's belly, hurrying down the catwalk to doorways with a visible airplane suspended outside. Indy climbs into the Biplane's cockpit, with Henry in the tail gunner's seat, as they notice two Messerschmidt fighter bombers emerging from the clouds and racing past on either side, forcing them to duck down.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Elsa is walking away in an open area reminiscent of the rally grounds often used for grandiose gatherings, with torches casting flickering shadows, vehicles idling ominously, and Nazi Officers standing with imposing presence in the background, one of whom is Indy, short for Indiana Jones, renowned for his archaeology adventures, who comes up to her before she knows he is there. Indy pushes Elsa against a stone column, likely part of the neo-classical architecture favored by the regime, and begins to search her clothing for the Grail Diary, an artifact of immense historical importance containing clues to the location of the Holy Grail, pulling the book from her pocket. His hands fly to her neck in a moment of tension, but Indy releases her and backs away, and she looks at him with a lover's pain, reminiscent of their complex relationship. Indy moves over to Henry, his father who is also a scholar of antiquities, and they almost run headlong into Hitler and his entire entourage coming down from the podium set up for his speech. Fifty enthusiastic kids push their autograph books, a common souvenir of the era, for Hitler's signature, and Hitler pauses to sign them, then looks Indy's way, and they make eye contact, a moment fraught with danger. Hitler breaks the spell by taking the Grail Diary from Indy, opens it to the first page filled with critical scholarly notes, and signs his autograph as though it were an ordinary book, then hands it back and moves on, oblivious to its significance. Indy’s motorcycle, a vintage model known for its speed and agility, pulls up to the main terminal as a Plainclothes Agent, perhaps a member of the Gestapo, distributes leaflets bearing Henry's picture to Nazi Soldiers inside the terminal. Henry leans in a doorway reading a newspaper, engaged in gathering information, as Indy enters down the stairs and taps Henry's shoulder. They begin to walk toward the boarding gates, with Henry looking over his newspaper at Indy, but Indy looks out the window and is suddenly concerned, spotting something urgent, rushing across the tarmac toward the Zeppelin, a colossal airship used for long-distance travel. Henry looks confused as everyone else with a ticket, printed with official Nazi insignia, quickly produces it and waves it in Indy’s face. Vogel, a high-ranking Nazi officer, gets to his knees, frustrated, as the huge Zeppelin rises into the sky above him, revealing an airplane attached to the belly of the airship, a clever engineering design allowing for airborne deployment, and he shakes his fist at the rising Zeppelin. Henry opens his Diary, filled with his research and discoveries, and begins to thumb through it, looking up from it, then closes it and leans back in his seat. Indy stutters uncomfortably, sensing the tension, as Henry stares at him, waiting for a response, while sunlight falls across the table from the window, turning like the hand of a clock over the tabletop across the drinks, symbols of their fleeting time. Indy appears puzzled as he and his father emerge from the hatchway into the belly of the Zeppelin, where the Zeppelin's elaborate metal framework is exposed, showcasing the marvels of early 20th-century aeronautical engineering. Indy and Henry hurry down the catwalk until arriving at a pair of doorways framed into the Zeppelin's outer skin, with plenty of blue sky and white clouds visible, and a small Biplane suspended from the Zeppelin by a hook and crane device, ready for a daring escape. Indy climbs into the cockpit of the Biplane, a two-seater aircraft often used for reconnaissance, as Henry takes the tail gunner's seat, then they both become aware of a strange sound in the skies behind them. Two Messerschmidt fighter bombers, the Luftwaffe's formidable warplanes, streak out of the clouds and race across the sky, forcing them to shrink in their seats as the Messerschmidts, going three times as fast, scream past on either side, highlighting the peril of their situation.

Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. Indy climbs into the cockpit of the Biplane as Henry takes the tail gunner's seat. then they both become aware of a strange sound in the skies behind them. Two Messerschmidt fighter bombers streak out of the clouds and race across the sky forcing them to shrink in their seats as the Messerschmidts going three times as fast scream past on either side.

Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. Henry looks confused as everyone else with a ticket quickly produces it and waves it in Indy’s face. Vogel gets to his knees as the huge Zeppelin rises into the sky above him revealing an airplane attached to the belly of the airship and he shakes his fist at the rising Zeppelin. Henry opens his Diary and begins to thumb through it looking up from it then closes it and leans back in his seat. Indy stutters uncomfortably as Henry stares at him waiting for a response. while sunlight falls across the table from the window turning like the hand of a clock over the tabletop across the drinks. Indy appears puzzled as he and his father emerge from the hatchway into the belly of the Zeppelin where the Zeppelin's elaborate metal framework is exposed. Indy and Henry hurry down the catwalk until arriving at a pair of doorways framed into the Zeppelin's outer skin with plenty of blue sky and white clouds visible and a small Biplane suspended from the Zeppelin by a hook and crane device. Indy climbs into the cockpit of the Biplane as Henry takes the tail gunner's seat. then they both become aware of a strange sound in the skies behind them. Two Messerschmidt fighter bombers streak out of the clouds and race across the sky forcing them to shrink in their seats as the Messerschmidts going three times as fast scream past on either side.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Elsa is walking away in an open area with torches vehicles and Nazi Officers in the background one of whom is Indy who comes up to her before she knows he is there. Indy pushes Elsa against a column and begins to search her clothing for the Diary pulling the book from her pocket. His hands fly to her neck but Indy releases her and backs away and she looks at him with a lover's pain. Indy moves over to Henry and they almost run headlong into Hitler and his entire entourage coming down from the podium. Fifty kids push their autograph books for Hitler's signature and Hitler pauses to sign them then looks Indy's way and they make eye contact. Indy appears puzzled as he and his father emerge from the hatchway into the belly of the Zeppelin where the Zeppelin's elaborate metal framework is exposed. Indy and Henry hurry down the catwalk until arriving at a pair of doorways framed into the Zeppelin's outer skin with plenty of blue sky and white clouds visible and a small Biplane suspended from the Zeppelin by a hook and crane device. Indy climbs into the cockpit of the Biplane as Henry takes the tail gunner's seat. then they both become aware of a strange sound in the skies behind them. Two Messerschmidt fighter bombers streak out of the clouds and race across the sky forcing them to shrink in their seats as the Messerschmidts going three times as fast scream past on either side.

Indy pushes Elsa against a column and begins to search her clothing for the Diary pulling the book from her pocket. then they both become aware of a strange sound in the skies behind them. Two Messerschmidt fighter bombers streak out of the clouds and race across the sky forcing them to shrink in their seats as the Messerschmidts going three times as fast scream past on either side.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Clara is gliding away in an enclosed jungle, with lanterns, bicycles, and Samurai Generals in the foreground, one of whom is Tony, who skips over to her before she realizes he is there. Tony pulls Clara against a tree and starts to inspect her backpack for the Scroll, grabbing the folder from her sleeve. His fingers dart to her wrist, but Tony frees her and steps back, and she gazes at him with a chef's sorrow. Tony ambles over to Jack, and they nearly barrel into Caesar and his entire retinue descending from the hill. Eighty parrots push their seed packets for Caesar's acknowledgment, and Caesar halts to stamp them, then glances Tony's direction, and they lock eyes. Caesar breaks the enchantment by snatching the Codex Scroll from Tony, flips it to the last page, and scribbles his mark, then tosses it back and trudges onward. Tony’s skateboard rolls up to the central terminal as a Disguised Spy hands out brochures featuring Jack's sketch to Samurai Warriors inside the station. Jack leans against a wall scanning a map as Tony strides down the ramp and pats Jack's elbow. They start to meander toward the departing docks, with Jack peering over his map at Tony, but Tony peers out the portal and suddenly becomes alarmed, dashing across the field toward the Blimp. Jack appears baffled as everyone else with a badge promptly displays it and shakes it in Tony’s view. Doyle gets to his toes as the immense Blimp lifts into the space above him, revealing a hovercraft latched to the underside of the dirigible, and he wags his fist at the ascending Blimp. Jack unfolds his Scroll and begins to skim through it, glancing up from it, then folds it and reclines in his chair. Tony mumbles awkwardly as Jack glares at him, anticipating a reply, while moonlight drapes across the counter from the door, rotating like the hand of a compass over the countertop past the cups. Tony seems confused as he and his uncle exit from the doorway into the belly of the Blimp, where the Blimp's intricate wooden framework is exposed. Tony and Jack scurry down the walkway until arriving at a set of windows framed into the Blimp's outer fabric, with ample stormy sky and gray fog visible, and a small Glider dangling from the Blimp by a latch and pulley system. Tony hops into the cockpit of the Glider as Jack takes the observation seat, then they both become aware of an odd noise in the sky above them. Three Dragonfly reconnaissance planes zoom out of the mist and dart across the heavens, prompting them to sink in their chairs as the Dragonflies, moving five times as swift, roar past on either side.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Elsa walks away in an open area with torches, vehicles, and Nazi Officers, including Indy who surprises her, retrieves a Diary from her pocket, but then retreats after a tense moment. Indy and Henry nearly collide with Hitler, who signs autographs, including the Grail Diary, and returns it to Indy. Indy’s motorcycle reaches the terminal where a Plainclothes Agent distributes leaflets with Henry's picture to Nazi Soldiers. Henry, reading a newspaper, meets Indy, but Indy becomes concerned and rushes towards the Zeppelin. As the Zeppelin ascends, Vogel shakes his fist below. Indy and Henry navigate the Zeppelin's interior, discovering a small Biplane attached beneath it. Indy takes the cockpit and Henry the tail gunner's seat as two Messerschmidt fighter bombers appear, forcing them to hunker down as the planes zoom past.
